entries.title: GPU-Driven Rendering Pipeline & Graphics API
description: Build the meshes all over inside Job System, reduce burden on main thread. Mesh data (transform, UVs, texture indices) is streamed directly to the GPU. CPU cost remains nearly constant regardless of visible voxel count.

notes.label: PROBLEM
notes.title: Why not use GPU Instancing?
description: [DrawMeshInstancedIndirect](https://docs.unity3d.com/6000.3/Documentation/ScriptReference/Graphics.DrawMeshInstancedIndirect.html) is only the best choice when the mesh is complex. For voxels, mesh generation must be done on GPU for instancing to work. This approach is not ideal for other dynamic processes.

notes.label: RESULT
description: Massive reduction in draw calls. Significant decrease in CPU overhead in dense scenes.

entries.title: Face-Level Visibility Control
description: Only exposed voxel faces are submitted to the render pipeline. Hidden faces are culled at generation time, preventing unnecessary GPU work.

notes.label: RESULT
description: Lower vertex throughput. Reduced overdraw during rendering.

entries.title: Texture Array Sampling
description: All voxel materials are stored in Texture2DArray assets. Texture switching is eliminated entirely during rendering. UVs and texture indices are resolved directly in the shader.

notes.label: RESULT
description: Zero material swaps. Improved GPU cache coherence.

entries.title: Chunk-Based Spatial Partitioning
description: World is divided into fixed-size chunks with deterministic bounds. Chunks outside the view range are unloaded or marked inactive.

notes.label: RESULT
description: Predictable memory usage. Stable frame times.

entries.title: Incremental Chunk Updates
description: Mesh data is regenerated only for affected chunks. Local voxel edits do not trigger full-world rebuilds.

notes.label: RESULT
description: Fast block placement. Fast block destruction even in large worlds.
